bibl.title: Francis Stephen Medcraf vs. Frank T. Hodge. Criminal.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Western District Court of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON. NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the matter of the petition of Francis Stephen Medcraf for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. ) No. 3038

This cause coming on for hearing on the 1st day of September, 1915, upon the petition of Francis Stephen Medcraf for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, and the cause having been submitted to the Court for final decision upon the return of the respondent, Robert T. Hodge, as Sheriff of King County, Washington, and upon the motion of said respondent, Robert T. Hodge, to quash the Writ heretofore issued in the above entitled cause and to dismiss the above entitled proceedings, and after argument of counsel, the Court being fully advised in the premises, and having filed its decision in writing denying the prayer of the petition, finds that the petition of Francis Stephen Medcraf does not state facts sufficient to entitle the said petitioner to a Writ of Habeas Corpus or to his discharge from the custody of said respondent, Robert T. Hodge, for the reason that the law of the State of Washington complained of is not in violation of the Constitution of the United States or the Fifth Amendment of the Constitution of the United States, or the Fourteenth Amendment of the Constitution of the United States.

NOW, THEREFORE, IT IS ORDERED AND DECREED That the petition of Francis Stephen Medcraf be dismissed and denied and the motion of the said respondent to quash the writ heretofore issued be granted and the petitioner, Francis Stephen Medcraf, be, and he
hereby is, remanded to the custody of Robert T. Hodge, as Sheriff of King County, Washington. To which has and are invalid
Done in open Court this 30th day of September, 1915.
COPY OF WITHIN ORDER RECEIVED AND DUE SERVICE OF SAME ACKNOWLEDGED THIS 30th DAY OF SEPTEMBER, 1915.
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION
IN THE MATTER OF THE PETITION OF FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
FILED IN THE U. S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION SEP301915
div1.ab: FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By Ed M Lakin Deputy
div1.p: ALFRED H. LUNDIN Prosecuting Attorney 1116-1124 Alaska Bldg. Seattle, Washington.
